alert.note: Alert for Clay; Clinton; Jackson; Platte; Ray (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 12:57AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wyandotte, east central Leavenworth, northeastern Johnson, south central Clinton, Clay, southwestern Ray, southeastern Platte and northern Jackson Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1257 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Quivira, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Overland Park, Independence, Shawnee, Lenexa, Leawood, Raytown, Liberty, Gladstone, Prairie Village, Lansing, Excelsior Springs, Merriam, Mission, Smithville, Kearney, Bonner Springs, Parkville, Edwardsville and North Kansas City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 410 and 423. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 28. Interstate 35 in Kansas between mile markers 224 and 235. Interstate 29 between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 635 between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 435 between mile markers 7 and 27, between mile markers 33 and 66, and between mile markers 77 and 80. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 225 and 226. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas...and west central Missouri.
